column1: Noor is making coffee at a busy shop. Noor wants to make a yummy coffee with oat milk for a person. Noor picks a milk jar and puts oat milk in it.
column2: Does Noor think the milk jar has oat milk or almond milk?
column3: Noor thinks the milk jar has almond milk.
column4: Noor thinks the milk jar has oat milk.

column1: Zara is attending an art exhibition at a local gallery in her town. Zara wants to learn more about a particular abstract painting she admires. The label next to the artwork states that the painting is the work of a famous artist, and Zara reads the label carefully.
column2: Does Zara believe the painting is the work of a famous artist or an emerging artist?
column3: Zara believes the painting is the work of an emerging artist.
column4: Zara believes the painting is the work of a famous artist.

column1: Carlos is a farmer in a little place, watching his corn field. He wants to give water to his plants by opening a water door connected to a river nearby. Carlos closed the water door last night.
column2: Does Carlos think the water door is closed or open?
column3: Carlos thinks the water door is already open.
column4: Carlos thinks the water door is still closed.

column1: Nia is in her room with her big toy cabinet. Nia wants to take out her doll to play with it. The cabinet door is shut tight.
column2: Does Nia think the cabinet door is shut or open?
column3: Nia thinks the cabinet door is open.
column4: Nia thinks the cabinet door is shut.

column1: Ugo is in his house with his small pet dog, Spot. Ugo wants to give Spot a new toy to play with. The toy is on the high shelf in the kitchen.
column2: Does Ugo think the toy is on the high shelf or on the floor?
column3: Ugo thinks the toy is on the floor.
column4: Ugo thinks the toy is still on the high shelf.

column1: Harry is at the beach with his red ball. Harry wants to play catch with the ball in the ocean. The ball is dry and ready for play.
column2: Does Harry think the ball is dry or wet?
column3: Harry thinks the ball is wet.
column4: Harry thinks the ball is dry.

column1: Umi is in her garden with her big, green plant. Umi wants to water the plant because it is a hot day. The plant is dry and needs water.
column2: Does Umi think the plant is dry or wet?
column3: Umi thinks the plant is wet.
column4: Umi thinks the plant is dry.

column1: Gracie is in her room with a big box of toys. Gracie wants to play with her favorite doll. The doll is in the box with all the other toys.
column2: Does Gracie think her doll is in the toy box or not in the toy box?
column3: Gracie thinks her doll is not in the toy box.
column4: Gracie thinks her doll is still in the toy box.

column1: Oliver is in the park with his friendly cat, Mittens. Oliver wants to warn Mittens not to climb the tall tree. The tree is very tall and scary.
column2: Does Oliver believe the tree is very tall and scary or less tall and less scary?
column3: Oliver believes the tree is less tall and less scary.
column4: Oliver believes the tree is very tall and scary.

column1: Annie is at the park with her kite. Annie wants to fly her kite in the sky. The kite is on the ground and ready to fly.
column2: Does Annie think the kite is on the ground or in the sky?
column3: Annie thinks the kite is in the sky.
column4: Annie thinks the kite is on the ground.
